com.facebook.rendercore

Interface ContentAllocator<Content>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Button, Card, CardClip, CardShadow, EditText, HorizontalScroll, HostRenderUnit, Image, MountSpecLithoRenderUnit, Progress, Recycler, RecyclerCollectionComponent, SizeSpecMountWrapperComponent, SolidColor, SpecGeneratedComponent, Spinner, TestComponent, TestDrawableComponent, TestLayoutComponent, TestSizeDependentComponent, TestTransitionComponent, TestViewComponent, Text, TextInput, TouchableFeedback, TransparencyEnabledCard, TransparencyEnabledCardClip, VerticalScroll, ViewCompatComponent, ViewPagerComponent, Wrapper

    public interface ContentAllocator<Content>
    Defines a class that can provide mountable content and have it be pooled.

    Instances must implement at least createContent method to allocate the RenderUnit content (View or Drawable).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_PREALLOCATION
      Default size of the content pool.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean canPreallocate()
      This API informs the framework to fill the content pool for this Mountable ahead of time.
      Content createContent(Context context)
      Allocates the mountable content (View or Drawable).
      default Content createPoolableContent(Context context)
      Creates a mount-content that can be pooled.
      default MountItemsPool.ItemPool createRecyclingPool()
      Creates an ItemPool for this mountable content.
      default java.lang.Object getPoolableContentType()
      Returns an object defining the type of the mount-content.
      default boolean isRecyclingDisabled()
      Return true if pooling should be disabled for this mount content.
      default MountItemsPool.ItemPool onCreateMountContentPool()
      Creates the content pool the framework should use for this Mountable.
      default int poolSize()
      This API informs the framework about the size of the content pool.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_MAX_PREALLOCATION

        static final int DEFAULT_MAX_PREALLOCATION
        Default size of the content pool.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • createContent

        Content createContent(Context context)
        Allocates the mountable content (View or Drawable).

      • createPoolableContent

        default Content createPoolableContent(Context context)
        Creates a mount-content that can be pooled. This is typically a View or Drawable subclass.

      • getPoolableContentType

        default java.lang.Object getPoolableContentType()
        Returns an object defining the type of the mount-content. Typically the mount-content's Class.

      • isRecyclingDisabled

        default boolean isRecyclingDisabled()
        Return true if pooling should be disabled for this mount content.

      • createRecyclingPool

        default MountItemsPool.ItemPool createRecyclingPool()
        Creates an ItemPool for this mountable content. Returning null will generate a default pool.

      • canPreallocate

        default boolean canPreallocate()
        This API informs the framework to fill the content pool for this Mountable ahead of time. The default value is false, i.e. content is not pre-allocated. Pre-allocation of the content can improve performance in some circumstances where creating the content is expensive.
        Returns:
        true to preallocate the content, otherwise false

        Experimental. Currently for Litho team internal use only.

      • poolSize

        default int poolSize()
        This API informs the framework about the size of the content pool. The default is 3.

        Experimental. Currently for Litho team internal use only.

      • onCreateMountContentPool

        default MountItemsPool.ItemPool onCreateMountContentPool()
        Creates the content pool the framework should use for this Mountable.

        Experimental. Currently for Litho team internal use only.
